pullRequest.body:
This lightens the very low-level `Mathlib/Data/Nat/Defs.lean` and `Mathlib/Init/Data/Nat/Lemmas.lean` a bit.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

nodes.body: Hmm... what's the motivation? I'm doing the inverse move in #11866 with the intention of clearly marking what's PRable to Std vs what's not.

LGTM

bors d+

:v: Ruben-VandeVelde can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
I think we've decided not to merge that PR?

### PR summary [1f6660b211](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/11891/commits/1f6660b2112c44a3a74dc63e453ed5c6720d4443)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.Data.Nat.Defs | 107 | 100 | -7 (-6.54%) |
| Mathlib.Data.Char | 108 | 101 | -7 (-6.48%) |
| Mathlib.Data.Int.Cast.Basic | 127 | 120 | -7 (-5.51%) |
| Mathlib.Data.Nat.PSub | 199 | 195 | -4 (-2.01%) |
| Mathlib.Data.Nat.Order.Lemmas | 211 | 208 | -3 (-1.42%) |
| Mathlib.Data.Seq.Computation | 271 | 268 | -3 (-1.11%) |
| Mathlib.Data.Int.LeastGreatest | 389 | 386 | -3 (-0.77%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
Too many changes (3862)!

</details>

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>
@YaelDillies wait, where was this decided? I think moving `Nat.find` to its own file is a good move.

> Hmm... what's the motivation? I'm doing the inverse move in #11866 with the intention of clearly marking what's PRable to Std vs what's not.

‚òùÔ∏è I'm hoping for `Data.Nat.Defs` to be a ForBatteries file, with stuff that's clearly marked as upstreamable

I don't see how putting `find` in its own file makes upstreaming any harder. And this PR is moving find out of `Init`, which is a good thing.

`Init` is a grab bag directory. Being in that directory doesn't mean "probably should go to Batteries".

In particular, I don't understand what you mean by "inverse" in your comment.
I verified that the new file doesn't have any dependencies that Batteries would worry about: https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/compare/nat-find-reduce-deps
bors merge
Canceled.
bors merge

Build failed (retrying...):
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9942109847/job/27462790157)

> I verified that the new file doesn't have any dependencies that Batteries would worry about: https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/compare/nat-find-reduce-deps

but can you ensure that via some `assert_not_exists`?

Build failed (retrying...):
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9943658003/job/27467985518)

`bors` is complaining about `shake`, probably because of this PR but I'm not sure. Merging `master` to test it.
bors r-
bors d+

:v: Ruben-VandeVelde can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
Canceled.
bors merge

  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9946653130/job/27477683933)

Build failed (retrying...):
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9947510171/job/27480299621)

Pull request successfully merged into master.

  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9948682341/job/27483698690)

> 
> but can you ensure that via some `assert_not_exists`?

üèì
